name: Shadow of Death: Wizard 26 / Shadowdancer 1 / Assassin 13
author: luck

posts.author: shia luck
posts.content:
???? ??? ??????? (Shadow of Death) Wizard 26 / Shadowdancer 1 / Assassin 13, Elf

A rather deadly assassin/mage using stealth and spells to prepare the killing ground with traps and get the first paralysis. Darkness spells to be always hitting the DA damage, HiPS, EMA and epic warding for defense, and a huge number of instant death spells for those pesky enemies with a decent AC. She is an elf 'cos I like elves and it gets her longbow usage, but apart from that, most other races are viable. Halfling would work well and human's extra feat could get you the weapon proficiency (and more skill points so create traps earlier.) But she was an elf when I played her sooooooo *grin*

..........................................................


The Lord is Shadow; I shall not want.
He maketh me to cast down in dark oblivion:
He leadeth me beside the still corpses.
He tortures my soul:
He leadeth me in the paths of wickedness
for his name’s sake.

Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
I will fear no evil:
For evil art with me;
my art and thy death
they consume me.

Thou preparest a table before me
in the presence of mine enemies:
Thou anointest my head with oil;
Their blood runneth over.

Surely evil and wickedness shall follow me
All the days of my life:
And I will dwell in the house of the Shadow Lord for ever.

...........................................................

Spells: Lots of Phantasmal killer, finger of death, wail of the banshee, darkness, invisibility, true strike, IGMS and the usual buffs

Advantages: Undispellable, master trapper and can create all but the deadly gas trap, HiPS with decent sneaking and invis if that fails, can cast darkness for auto sneak attack damage, full power mage with instant death spells galore and scribe scrolls, and can self haste to 4 APR if no perma haste items giving two death attack paralysis chances in the first flurry, oh and UMD too.

Disadvantages: Bloody awful AB, even buffed so true strike, divine power scrolls if you can buy them or go to spells when you can't hit someone. Usual MMM issue so not a biggie. Crafting traps comes late which is a shame (tho you could drop search points for it if that suits the environment better, which it unfortunately didn't where I was playing her).


Can't find any similar builds in the search engine, which surprises me. Usually I build something and then find it already done more or less. Anyway, I am always happy to be corrected so if someone knows of a similar build...

Comments, crticism and cheeky replies welcome

Have fun

posts.author: Devlinor
posts.content:
here's my take. First, I can't see what Assassin is bringing to the build. It is a nice Death attack DC but you probably won't live long enough to exploit it much. I would have gone for Rogue instead. That would have netted you many more skill points and open lock as a class skill. Also, with 13 lvls of rogue, I would take either ED or CS and use that to the best. the 1 SD cheese tactic is old. I would drop wizzy down to 22 or 23 with rogue at 12 and boost the SD to 5 You get a free feat with that, I believe. Since your using a pointy ear with this one, the Rogue/wizard combo is a great idea.

concerning the wizzy lvling here. I would move Extend to the first feat slot and, if you are still going to go for the silent spell, move it to where you take the extend. You need that early goose in the timeing with your spells, and taking silent first is non productive since you take wizard for 13 straight lvls. You have no reason to take the silent that soon in your career. Extended mage armor, and extended magic weapon (once you can cast that version of it) would do you much more good.

Quite frankly, I would go with a rogue heavy wizard and kick in some assassin or SD. With that combo you could easily be slinging spells, and dealing death in short order. IMO the assassin class is a bit underpowered in many servers, while the rogue is still holding strong.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
I disagree with Dev about the usefulness of Assassin since with a MM playstyle the mobs will be hitten by it and HiPS makes it easy to fire DAs left and right. Against a non true seeing boss spamming it (with True Strike support) will eventually work too.

What I question is the usefulness of focusing on illusion (phantasmal killer gets a double save, fort and will, that is a big drawback IMO). If I were to pick a secondary school I'd go with enchantment which often lets you harvest strong allies (mostly meleers which have a weak will save). I'd also like to see craft wand in the build since, let's face it, spells ain't never enough and craft wand lets you spam some pretty nice spells all across the magician's career. I'd also like to see SP feats. Summing up I'd drop SF/GSF/ESF: Illusion for either SF/GSF/ESF: Enchantment or SP/GSP/ESP. I'd drop Silent Spell for Craft Wand (rearranging feat selection of course).

If weapon feats could be worked in it would be nice too. That would have to come at the cost of the SF or SP line of feats though.

Considering your starting stats, Elf is not really helping much. I'd go with Halfling and better exploit the racial modifiers together with small size or human for the extra feat and skillpoints.

Anyhow, I do like the build. A nice arcane assassin with lots of potential, it's surely a fun build to play. Congrats for your first build in these glorious halls.

All hail Shia!

posts.author: shia luck
posts.content:
Devlinor wrote:here's my take. First, I can't see what Assassin is bringing to the build. It is a nice Death attack DC but you probably won't live long enough to exploit it much. I would have gone for Rogue instead. That would have netted you many more skill points and open lock as a class skill. Also, with 13 lvls of rogue, I would take either ED or CS and use that to the best. the 1 SD cheese tactic is old. I would drop wizzy down to 22 or 23 with rogue at 12 and boost the SD to 5 You get a free feat with that, I believe. Since your using a pointy ear with this one, the Rogue/wizard combo is a great idea.
Yip rogue for sp would be nice but her concept is assassin sooooo *grin* . Plus ED needs 25 dex leaving her with a much reduced casting DC. Wizard below 24 means dispellable, which I hate having. I am not sure why you think she won't live a long time. She can dispel anyone's TS, has HiPS, imp invis, DR, EMA and epic warding, spell mantles, fights in darkness and can bigby, not to mention those nasty death spells.
Devlinor wrote:
concerning the wizzy lvling here. I would move Extend to the first feat slot and, if you are still going to go for the silent spell, move it to where you take the extend. ...
Good idea yes Thanks for commenting

KailPendragon wrote:I disagree with Dev about the usefulness of Assassin since with a MM playstyle the mobs will be hitten by it and HiPS makes it easy to fire DAs left and right. Against a non true seeing boss spamming it (with True Strike support) will eventually work too.

What I question is the usefulness of focusing on illusion (phantasmal killer gets a double save, fort and will, that is a big drawback IMO). If I were to pick a secondary school I'd go with enchantment which often lets you harvest strong allies (mostly meleers which have a weak will save).
Yip, phantasmal killer is good for rogues and not much else *laughing* . Enchantment would be a much stronger choice. I just wanted a LOT of insta death spells *evil grin*
KailPendragon wrote:I'd also like to see craft wand in the build since, let's face it, spells ain't never enough and craft wand lets you spam some pretty nice spells all across the magician's career. I'd also like to see SP feats. Summing up I'd drop SF/GSF/ESF: Illusion for either SF/GSF/ESF: Enchantment or SP/GSP/ESP. I'd drop Silent Spell for Craft Wand (rearranging feat selection of course).
More good ideas. Hmmm, only problem is silent spell gives me another spell level for the single shot insta death spells. I'm probably better dropping maximise spell cos when playing her I am not using maxed IGMS, just a lot of wail of the Banshee. Seems wrong to have a caster without all the metamagic feats tho *grin*. Craft wand IS a very nice feat to have tho.

I often wonder about SP feats. I mean, ok if the environment has items with SR32, then very good idea for this build to get them, but otherwise, 32 is still too low, no? I normally only bother with SP feats with a lvl 38 caster type so I have a decent chance of getting pure monks. What's your opinion on that?
KailPendragon wrote:
If weapon feats could be worked in it would be nice too. That would have to come at the cost of the SF or SP line of feats though.
I thought about PBS and rapid shot too at a cost of 1DC. I just hate reducing a casting DC tho.
KailPendragon wrote:
Considering your starting stats, Elf is not really helping much. I'd go with Halfling and better exploit the racial modifiers together with small size or human for the extra feat and skillpoints.
Yip, it's just me and elves *grin* . Both of those are better.
KailPendragon wrote:
Anyhow, I do like the build. A nice arcane assassin with lots of potential, it's surely a fun build to play. Congrats for your first build in these glorious halls.

All hail Shia!
Thank you *curtseying*

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
shia luck wrote:
Yip, phantasmal killer is good for rogues and not much else *laughing* . Enchantment would be a much stronger choice. I just wanted a LOT of insta death spells *evil grin*
Fine
shia luck wrote:I often wonder about SP feats. I mean, ok if the environment has items with SR32, then very good idea for this build to get them, but otherwise, 32 is still too low, no? I normally only bother with SP feats with a lvl 38 caster type so I have a decent chance of getting pure monks. What's your opinion on that?
Don't get caught up in figures. A 32+1d20 SP is simply the top you can get with a lvl 26 mage, it's not related to maximum toolset SR (for which 31+1d20 suffices btw). The rationale is to be able to penetrate the highest SR possible (counting a mord's effect too, when applicable) which can be an important factor depending on the environment. Also, SR/GSR if acquired early on, will definitely help your mage as he levels up, unless SR enemies are just lacking.

Anyhow, everything is environmental so one can choose whether to get the extra focused school, the extra SP or the extra battle prowess.
shia luck wrote:
KailPendragon wrote:
If weapon feats could be worked in it would be nice too. That would have to come at the cost of the SF or SP line of feats though.
I thought about PBS and rapid shot too at a cost of 1DC. I just hate reducing a casting DC tho.
To be clear, I was thinking of coupling weapon feats with halfling and a higher starting Dex (Dex 16, Con 14, Str 8) which takes advantage of small size and possibly of good aim too depending on whether one goes for finesse+wf dagger+ewf dagger or pbs+wf sling+ewf sling. Net result is 28 AB melee or 29 AB thrown weapons/sling (21 +1 small size +1 wf +2 ewf +3 dex and +1 good aim for thrown weapons/sling) which is not bad at all for a caster build.
shia luck wrote:Thank you *curtseying*
My pleasure

posts.content:
KailPendragon wrote:

I normally only bother with SP feats with a lvl 38 caster type so I have a decent chance of getting pure monks. What's your opinion on that?
Don't get caught up in figures. A 32+1d20 SP is simply the top you can get with a lvl 26 mage, it's not related to maximum toolset SR (for which 31+1d20 suffices btw). The rationale is to be able to penetrate the highest SR possible (counting a mord's effect too, when applicable) which can be an important factor depending on the environment. Also, SR/GSR if acquired early on, will definitely help your mage as he levels up, unless SR enemies are just lacking.

Anyhow, everything is environmental so one can choose whether to get the extra focused school, the extra SP or the extra battle prowess.
That's a very good point. We'll be doing a levelling up/testing playthrough of the module we are working on soon so I might downlevel her and go that SP route and see how it works out. My iconic sorceresses use enchantment focus so that is less appealing even tho it's likely the more powerful route.

Tho now of course I am wondering whether the environment is just a bit light on SR type enemies. Perhaps I should be changing that as well? *grinning*

Made me rethink about her a lot Kail, thank you. I might have to go through my builds and the search engine and try this again *grin*.
